website_summaries.verdict: An extremely small tool that only weighs 1.4 pounds and comes with a versatile 41-piece drill and drive bit set.
pros: This compact, easy-to-carry drill-driver is best suited for the lightest duty applications
It comes with 2 batteries, a charger, a soft carry bag, and a drill-drive bit set
The comprehensive bit set includes items that may be beyond the power scope of this pocket drill
cons: As with other Bosch models, there can be some dissatisfying play that creates a wobble in the bits

customer_reviews.title: Good power but didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit but the top (motor) is bigger and heavier than I like. There is a trade-off there because I guess they couldn't get the power out of it if they made it smaller. I was used to the Snap-on (CTS761) gun that is over $400 for a 2 battery kit. The Bosch unit is much better deal for the money. UPDATE: Picked it up to use it after owning/using it infrequently for 3 months and it was making a grinding noise turning with no power at all. I suspect the clutch mechanism is stripped or loose inside. Sent it in for repair with an authorized service center. I may have to try another brand :-((
customer_reviews.author: Tsip

customer_reviews.title: We like!
customer_reviews.text: I really like and it does a really nice job for what I needed to do. The one thing that kind of annoys me is there's no storage on it for bits and so I'm always looking for where I put down the other bit. I'm in the middle of refinishing an RV that uses a lot of square bits but there's also some Phillips heads, so I have to switch between the two. Other than that it's a really nice tool. The charger works pretty fast and the battery seems to last a long time I have yet to actually drain the battery all the way. I put it in a charger before that.
customer_reviews.author: Bobfnbw

customer_reviews.title: Bits are Too Loose in the Hex Chuck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older version of this 10.8v/12v compact drill/driver that I used for a long time. This newer model is a disappointment. While it has all the great features and ease of handling everyone raves about, it is nearly useless for drilling. Screwdriver and drill speed-bits are inserted into the hex chuck as before, but they are loose. Too loose. A standard drill bit that is 2.5" long will flop around at the point by nearly 1/8". This makes starting holes slow and messy, and or me, it really lessens the convenience of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: justaguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for around the house too
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this thing! I bought it for a big move with lots of Ikea furniture to dis-assemble/re-assemble, and it was perfect. It has way more torque than I expected, gets into tight spaces, is light enough for a kid to help out, holds a long charge, and just generally makes life easier. I also really like the included case which has room for a few extra tools. I would recommend it to anyone without hesitation. I had no bits or drills, so I added thewhich has a great variety. I've found though that the Bosch quick-release bits are a little wobbly in the chuck and actually I prefer these smaller ones for driving:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product... does well what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I like Bosch products period. I was looking for a good, small, hand held replacement for a Stanley that finally gave up the ghost. This little jewel fits the bill nicely. It's got two batteries (good!) and a quick charge (good). It has a short shoulder so you can get a fairly parallel drive angle on the screws that are hidden next to a shelf (or in my case a photography tripod head) and plenty of power for your normal screw driving / extraction. It's a mid range power model. I like the illuminating light that helps these old eyes see the screw head. It's American made... we need more of those.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Van Devender

customer_reviews.title: Being an HVAC technician this is the best thing I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Being an HVAC technician this is the best thing I've ever bought. It's small, gets into tight places and has plenty of torque for stubborn bolts and screws. It's also light weight and fits in my backpack. When you add a flex bit it get in to the even tighter spaces... it's an invaluable tool. I can get 2 weeks out of a battery on standard service calls.
customer_reviews.author: C. Halbert

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as the Milwaukee M12 screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: This is almost as good as the Milwaukee M12 screwdriver, a little less power and no battery gauge. Although the body is smaller so that is good in tight spaces and has a 2 speed transmission. It's all the same market anyway so if you already have the Bosch batteries and chargers you will not really go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: MacBits LLC

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old single speed that I burned out, repaired and burned out again. I loved the old one, so light and compact, lasting over six years with almost daily use. This one has more torque settings and is dual speed! Whaaat? With a hex chuck this drill has done everything I've asked of it so far. The batteries are the only cordless tool batteries I've had that haven't gone bad. The 2 Ah batteries are an improvement over my old but still functioning 1.3 Ah batteries. I look forward to using this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Blabs a Lot

customer_reviews.title: fits my hand so nicely
customer_reviews.text: I'm an 82 year old lady that still needs to do minor repairs etc. around my home so was looking for a reasonably small, light weight, comfortable to use screw driver and this one works beautifully for me and I wish I had of bought it years ago. I had a couple of the big battery, long handled blue Mikita type but they were too big and heavy. This drill if powerful and perfect and does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: Important information not given
customer_reviews.text: This drill doesn't drill with what comes with it, or with a standard Bosch drill set that I also bought. There was no information that all drills would need to have a hex base in order to be used. I now have a nice screwdriver, and an expensive set of drills I can't use. Description should be changed to alert to the necessary drills.
customer_reviews.author: Clancy

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool! It is easily my favorite tool, lol. Perfectly balanced in your hand, comfortable grip, light weight and powerful. It comes with two lips battery packs, charger and a quality bag. I am using it primarily for RC cars stubby, shallow profile works out great. If I had to nit-pick I would want the clutch to go 1 setting lower to prevent stripping on some of my softer plastics. Overall, I highly recommend this driver indwell be buying a 2nd very soon!
customer_reviews.author: ADB2

customer_reviews.title: Good luck changing the battery!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice 1/4 inch drill with the exception of the battery system. Why Bosch makes the batteries so difficult to get out of their Max tools, I do not know. You would think their engineers would consider that not all of us have great thumb strength, especially as we grow older. It sure would be nice to have a system that doesn't require the use of a vice or water pump pliers to remove the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper to buy a new one when batteries fail
customer_reviews.text: Sad that they can't lower the price on their batteries. I pretty much bought refurbished one just for batteries but will only use as backup when I'm on a ladder or in attic. I've returned to corded models building decks, fences, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Surbs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for around the house jobs, I had been using bigger impact drills for small jobs and it’s overkill. This drill is just perfect, small and lightweight. I use it all the time now. Very powerful. Definitely worth trying!
customer_reviews.author: RyanEnergizerTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Drill portion going bad
customer_reviews.text: I have had this compact drill/driver for a little over 7 months. When I select #2 to use as a drill, it sounds like it is grinding and I see sparks in the motor. I would love to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Tool
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a gigantic Makita with NiCads. Lightweight, high torque, solidly built. Works flawlessly. The short-nosed hex bit chuck allows drill to be closer to work which is a huge advantage turning hurricane shutter screws, for example. There seems to be a large variety of hex bit drills and tools available; the 34-piece set has all I need for now.
customer_reviews.author: WAnderson

customer_reviews.title: Great product improvement
customer_reviews.text: Got 6 years out of the previous version and it was still going strong. Gave it to my apprentice. This one has the normal quality feel and build spec. Having the 2 speed clutch is an improvement over my older one. I drain a battery every other day so it has heavy use
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: the driving continues to work at a superior level of quality
customer_reviews.text: As of today, 12/10/15, the driving continues to work at a superior level of quality. The battery life is remarkable. I have gone months between uses and the battery remained charged and the driver was ready. The batteries do recharge in about 30 minutes. My friends are jealous. I cannot over recommend this driver. It's a marvel.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Clarke

customer_reviews.title: great little drill
customer_reviews.text: I use these more often as a screwdriver than a drill. They've got lots of torque if you need it for drilling, and an excellent clutch so as not to strip out heads of relatively small screws. Probably not the best value unit available, but smaller, lighter and easier to handle than most others so perfect for this application, as well as a general use drill, keeping in mind the quick change bit holder needs hex style bits. Also, these used to be labeled 9.6 (9.8?) volts, but I understand Bosch is now calling the same battery a 12 volt. In any case they're completely interchangeable between those labeled 9.x volt and 12 volt, both in use and in charging.
customer_reviews.author: vinnyf

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a smaller drill/driver this is the one. This is my 3rd one. I have many Dewalt drills, many. For handy, quick, small spot to work in this is the drill to buy. 12 volt, not 3 or 4 volt.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: This drill is an excellent "in between" drill for jobs where a bigger drill ...
customer_reviews.text: This drill is an excellent "in between" drill for jobs where a bigger drill won't fit and the really compact drills don't have the power to do the job. I have only done a few small jobs with it so far, but expect to use it a lot starting next Spring. I like the 1/4" Hex Shank and the sleeve to lock the bit in place, as well as the built in light.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: DEAD after light use, 21 months after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: DEAD after light use, 21 months after purchase. Worked fine and battery life was decent considering size. Only complait was an intermitten delay between pressing the trigger and the motor starting. Not sure if that is normal, maybe I had a defect the entire time. In any case i was working on a project and the drill died. It was only used occasionally for hobbies and that was light use. $79.99 down the drain. Last Bosch tool I buy. I have cheap drills that are still working way longer than the Bosch and no delay issue.
customer_reviews.author: K DUB

customer_reviews.title: Look for somethings else, too weak
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing special for the price, it's definitely on the weak side of wireless tools
customer_reviews.author: Steve James Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing torque.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to imagine getting a lot of torque out of such a small package. Now that I've seen what it can do, I'll never buy those clunky 18V drivers. If you're in construction, and need a small driver to fit into tight spaces, this little baby will do the job. I drove 3 and a quarter inch galvanized screws through two by fours, that were layed over 3/4 inch plywood into the floor joist and this thing never hesitated, never slipped out of the screw head either on slow speed. I am really impressed. Seems like pretty long battery life too. Like longer than I'm used to with portable tools.
customer_reviews.author: cabinfever

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I have tons of power tools of all sorts, but when it comes to speeding up assembly of random purchases, repairs, or anything else around the house, this tool is the biggest time saver there is.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bellman

customer_reviews.title: Highly dissappointed.
customer_reviews.text: So far works as expected and previous review about the quick screw tip attachment being loose is accurate. I have 20 dollar 3.7 volt screwdrivers that have a tighter/more secure fit, so I am only giving it 3 stars rather than 5. Highly disappointed with this attachment because its hard to use with any kind of long bit or extension. I am thinking of returning it because bit wobbles and its hard to use if you are balancing a heavy item with one hand while trying to drive a screw in......what was bosch engineers thinking......?
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Light Too
customer_reviews.text: This is My 3rd Bosh mini driver. AWESOME Torque. Loaned one out, came back with LOW gears knocked out, High still works fine. For its size, it is incredibly STRONG.. Be careful not to use this one in place of ones THREE times larger - It is Tempting to do so
customer_reviews.author: D. Seeman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent driver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent driver. I have an old Black and Decker drill set that I use for occassional drilling and driving screws and such. It works fine, but is large and clunky. This Bosch works far better for household jobs and does not feel unwieldy. The Lithium battery lasts at least 3 times as long as my old NiCad battery. I highly recommend it. We move aroud frequently, and are constantly assembling furniture and hanging pictures on the wall. At least for smaller projects,this has been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lacy Sr.

customer_reviews.title: This Drill is/was a great drill for small home task
customer_reviews.text: This Drill is/was a great drill for small home task. Within my family we have purchased three and two have failed, while I know that tools do fail I dont expect them to after limited use and two months of ownership. I will steer clear from Bosch in my next drill purchase.
customer_reviews.author: junior

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable Problems
customer_reviews.text: I could not get the battery out for charging and the drill holder was missing.
customer_reviews.author: fiddler

customer_reviews.title: a good product
customer_reviews.text: I have the milwaukee driver and am not impressed with it. I thought I would try the Bosch. In my opinion, it is a better tool than the milwaukee. First- it is just as powerful. remember it is only a 12volt tool, it can't do everything. Second - it has a natural feel when you pick it up and use it. The weight to balance seems just right. And third - the speed trigger is very accurate. This helps when driving into hard wood or wood that may be prone to splitting. You can start slow, speed up, and then stop at the exact spot to assure the screw is seated just right.
customer_reviews.author: looseknot

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool....But...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a tool expert, but this driver has a ton of power for its size. It's easy to use and hold and I love the small batteries and the fast charger. This unit is replacing a DeWalt 7.2volt screwdriver that still works but the batteries are dying. It was more cost effective to upgrade to this than to replace my old batteries. The only downside is the case. The case has a clear, plastic holder for the paperwork when what it needs is a zippered compartment to hold driver bits. Who totes the instruction manual around when you're out working? Great driver. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dufus

customer_reviews.title: A handy tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought my pocket driver after being shocked with the replacement cost of batteries for my 12V Milwaukee small driver. For a few dollars more over the cost of the Milwaukee battery, I could buy the Bosch pocket driver. The Bosch is powerful and slightly smaller than the Milwaukee. I like the two speed switch. My only complaint is the trigger is not quite as responsive to activate the driver as it could be. It seems like there is a split second wait until the driver is activated.. The batteries seem to hold up quite well, and charging is quick. This is a very hancy tool. J.D..
customer_reviews.author: Jerry E. Diebel

customer_reviews.title: My husband was so pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: He loves this Christmas gift and the pocket sized power it delivers! He regularly grabs for it to do household repairs and projects now!
customer_reviews.author: Dena Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! I do cabinet installation
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! I do cabinet installation, and this is a go to tool. Just replaced my old one after more than 10 yrs service. Used on a daily basis. Love the more compact size. Have only had this one for 3 months, but expect another 10 plus years service from it. I have 6 of the 12v tools and use them almost exclusively. When I pick up my 18v now, it seems like such a monster.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID PARKER

customer_reviews.title: This is the best drill driver I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best drill driver I've ever owned. I had the model before this one and it lasted 3 plus years, so when it died, I replaced it with the improved version. I do appliance repair, so I'm using this baby every day. Battery life is forever and it has plenty of speed and power to get the job done. This is a best buy in drill drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I wish that the prior writers could have reached out and hit the buy button. I agonized over this purchase for several months since my cordless drill did what this does. Well, just buy it! This has more power than needed. Lighter feel than the numbers tell you and weight is not needed to drive a screw. It fits where a full size screwdriver won't. Easy to switch heads but will not let them go while working. This is the best tool purchase in years and I buy a LOT of tools (just don't tell my wife!). Made me think of the the old advertisement: This ain't your father's cordless screwdriver...
customer_reviews.author: Curious John

customer_reviews.title: 12v on steroids. Best drill for anything within a 256lb work load
customer_reviews.text: Best drill available imo. Youll be amazed at the power behind this lil bugger and and the chuck speed variance is incredible. Can spin it suuuuper slow and the top end zips it right in. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bojangles and Rocky Balboa

customer_reviews.title: so far I really like this drill it works well and I like where ...
customer_reviews.text: so far I really like this drill it works well and I like where the reverse and forward button is I don't bump it all the time it is a new drill so time will tell how long it lasts but the functions in the size are really nice
customer_reviews.author: mlady

customer_reviews.title: Product is perfect highly recomend!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i chose this because working in construction Bosch is one of the best names in the business. I wanted to get a screw gun for work around the house and one that can get into tight spaces. This tool is perfect for what i need. Try getting a regular dewalt screw gun in a draw for child proofing its a nightmare plus the old school hold the end of it to set the bit is annoying and will rip up your hand if not done correctly...this simply pull up and drop bit and done...the size allows me to get into a lot more areas and do more. I highly recommend this product and the price is great too,
customer_reviews.author: anthony d'amico

customer_reviews.title: only one can say much better than previous model PS20
customer_reviews.text: It is BOSCH .... Had many different models , only one can say much better than previous model PS20 . Short body ! 2 speeds ! Better battery power . No Idea about battery life yet ...But works very hard ! As Acoustic system specialist have to build a lot of boxes and mount and remove a lot of speakers . Short body great for working inside speaker system enclosure !
customer_reviews.author: champ

customer_reviews.title: Don not buy to use with Bosch Clic Change drill/driver set!
customer_reviews.text: Wwhen you order a Bosch PS21 Pocket Driver a helpful screen comes up suggesting buying the Bosch CC2130 Clic Change Drill/Driver bit set as an ideal package. But be warned that I had to return the bit set as the fancy Clic Change Chuck requires a 3/8" chuck and this driver doesn't have one! Unfortunate waste of my time and it too bad as it looks like very high quality tool bits. Plus Amazon is on the hook for six bucks return postage that isn't good for us shareholders! As for the Bosch PS21, it is a joy to use and has replaced both my cordless drill set and my power screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: SeaBear

customer_reviews.title: Small form factor cordless driver
customer_reviews.text: A solid 5 out of 5! Well built, high quality parts, good design. Bosch is solid and never lets me down. I got this ps-21 for the small form factor, came with 2 batteries and a charger.awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best Drill Every Owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as a Christmas present. The first one did not work and had a cracked led lens. Amazon took care of it right away. They picked up the broken one, and shipped another right away. She loves this drill, and so do I. I have had three DeWalts with NiCad batteries. The batteries just go bad quickly. I gave all three away. I have about 5 other drills with and without cords and a drill press. This is the best for what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: JACK

customer_reviews.title: broke the first day
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke the first day I used it. I know it has to be very uncommon occurrence with Bosch but now I have to return it and makes me wish I had bought it from a brick and mortar store rather than online.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Power in a tidy compact package
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed! It's compact and ergonomic enough that my small hands can work with it without any discomfort. Powerful enough that I needn't switch/charge the battery before I finished with my project. It's packaged nicely with a soft case; this makes storage easier as I live in the city and do not have a lot of space. Oh, and I love the LED illuminating light. Now I feel inspired to take on other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Irene (MIA) Mitra

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best 12v pocket driver on the market
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best 12v pocket driver on the market. Powerful, lighted, universal bit holder. Great for all those little jobs around the house. You can spend an extra $30 for brushless and get only one battery, but you don't need to.
customer_reviews.author: JD4D

customer_reviews.title: I feel it would be better to control the speed on the trigger by applying ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as it is lighter and I thought would be easier on joints prone to arthritis. It is to an extent. I don't care for the high/low feature of the design. I feel it would be better to control the speed on the trigger by applying more or less pressure. Also, the batteries die in less than 24 hours on stand by and in a matter of hours when in use. I will need to purchase additional batteries if I want to do larger projects around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: nice driver
customer_reviews.text: while it doesn't have the driving power and run time of a higher voltage heavier driver, it works great when building cabinets. Light weight, comfortable to hold, the headlight is a boon when working in blind spots or inside cabinets. One slight negative is that it doesn't have the battery charge level indicator lights included with the 12 volt companion drill/driver. Don't understand why those were omitted on this unit. To check the charge level of a battery I have to switch the battery over to the drill/driver.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products that you don't recognize you need until you use it. Super light, very powerful (I was driving 3" construction screws), and good battery longevity. The dual speed works great. And the torque control works great also. I've always used a cordless drill for driving screws but this is MUCH better.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: good buy.
customer_reviews.text: my co-workers have this and their mechanics and they use this for tightening bolts so comes real handy for also household screws to drill light works..
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Santa-Iglesia

customer_reviews.title: Bosch PS21-2A 12V Max 2-Speed Pocket Driver Kit with 2 Batteries, Charger and Case
customer_reviews.text: I got it for a great price that I could not turn down. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: N7AS

customer_reviews.title: Bosch 12v cordless Pocket screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: This is the Bosch 12v cordless pocket screwdriver. nice kit with 2 batteries and charger.
customer_reviews.author: j glassey

customer_reviews.title: Bosch quality again
customer_reviews.text: Small and light weight but with a powerful motor. Great speed control and easy reverse lever. Two speed gearbox for more torque or more speed. Torque limiter is progressive and consistent. Battery system is fantastic, batteries charge quickly and hold their charge for months if stored. Battery charge level lights work well.
customer_reviews.author: WatchFetish

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: These tools are excellent. I have used other "Brand Name" ni-cad battery tools and the batteries die and are big and clunky. I have the Bosch Impact Driver (PS-41) and Pocket Driver (PS-21)I used them recently building a set for school play driving 2" plus screws in 2x4's flawlessly all day. The battery's charge faster (Min) than they discharge during use. Both tools outperformed a "brand name" ni-cad drill. Three volunteer Dad's who were working on the project with me went out and bought the drills next day on Amazon. The tools are small but powerful, I would recommend it to anyone, homeowner or professional.
customer_reviews.author: dkmanley

customer_reviews.title: I use infrequently but love it// battery holds its charge forever
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these drills (two were its predecessor-/ same but with shorter "nose." Two were gifts, one for myself. I use infrequently but love it// battery holds its charge forever, it is lightweight (no bulky battery), yet powerful enough to do the job. The ease of switching bits and driver heads is great, yet the only downside was the expense of having to buy all new drill bits and driver bits.
customer_reviews.author: C E Bower

customer_reviews.title: Handy handy
customer_reviews.text: Handy little guy to have around when you either need something quick or in tighter spaces than my major drill can accommodate easily. Also good for hurricanes windows. Double battery and case made even more of a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Solecki

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Great power screwdriver. Plenty of power, but more control than impact units.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schiller

customer_reviews.title: 1 Battery
customer_reviews.text: My order came with one bad battery . I just want a replacement battery but only choice is a return
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Drill it harder
customer_reviews.text: This drill kicks ass! I bought it specifically because of its small size so I could open my crate at a trade show I flew to. Needed to get my checked bag of various tools under 50 lbs so size mattered (ba-doom, tsss). The batter lasts a long time & the drill provided plenty of torque to back out all 24 3" screws. I've been a DeWalt man for years but I guess now I have another option for go-to in the future
customer_reviews.author: Doublec96

customer_reviews.title: Love that it comes with two batteries
customer_reviews.text: Fits my small hands and is very portable. Love that it comes with two batteries, charger, and one cross tip bit and one flat tip bit. Battery stays charged for a year if you haven't used it. Perfect size drill for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: I use it daily doing repair work. It holds a battery life for a long time. It's powerful and it had endured a few misuses
customer_reviews.author: keefer

customer_reviews.title: drop from roof two story's into bulkhead bounced off concrete cellar floor
customer_reviews.text: nothing broke i still use it everyday very tough little driver!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I have this one and the model with the regular chuck as well and I'm totally happy with them both...
customer_reviews.author: Tim Markowicz

customer_reviews.title: compact!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional home inspector, and have been for over 24 years. I carry a screw gun to take off the covers on breaker panes, and other small chores. I have had several different ones over the years. This is absolutely the best, plenty of torque, long battery life and the light is a handy touch. This is a tiny little thing for its power. Over the years my tool bag has lost probably 20 pounds due to lithium ion tools! Course Bosch is the best always!
customer_reviews.author: John F. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small driver
customer_reviews.text: I use this to assemble grills and other items for a large company. It has a great battery life and easy to use Very light so you don't get fatigued.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lund

customer_reviews.title: So far I like it. If I have any issues
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it. If I have any issues, I will repost. Be aware that it does not come with any bits. You will need to purchase those extra. It wasn't a big deal for me since I already had a driver/drill bit set. Also, its not a "bright" led light but I didn't buy this pocket driver for spelunking. It's plenty bright enough to illuminate the work area.
